Sonya Bhatia Posmentier, the daughter of Loveleen and Eric Posmentier of Manhattan, is to be married today to Jess Francis Row, a son of Constance and Clark Row of Edgewood, Md. Bruce Blair, the abbott of the New Haven Zen Center, is to perform a ceremony that will incorporate Hindu and Jewish traditions at the Hammond Museum in North Salem, N.Y.
The bride and bridegroom, both 25, graduated from Yale University, where they met.

Ms. Posmentier, who will keep her name, received a master's degree in creative writing from the University of Oregon. This month, the bride is to begin teaching high school English at the Roeper School in Birmingham, Mich. Her father is a professor of physics at the Brooklyn campus of Long Island University. Her mother is a psychoanalyst in Manhattan.

Mr. Row is a candidate for a master's degree in creative writing at the University of Michigan at Ann Arbor. His parents are consultants in natural resources, health care and nonprofit management, in Edgewood.
